History of Present Illness:
Mr. ___ is a ___ y/o male with a history of HFrEF (EF 25%

block s/p dual lead AICD, CKD, DM, and PVD s/p left SFA to DP
bypass
graft who presents after recent admission ___ - ___ for

He reports that he was been feeling generally unwell x 1 week 
but
otherwise without F/C, CP, SOB, abd pain. 

He was recently admitted ___ with LGIB s/p clipping to
Dieulafoy lesion on ___ with stabilization of H/H and 
reinitation
of anticoagulation/aspirin. (Of note, patient's reduced dose
xarelto was transitioned to apixaban 2.5mg daily.) 

Of note, the patient was also admitted to ___ from
___ for non-healing left foot wounds. He underwent left
SFA to DP bypass graft on ___ and left ___ toe 
amputations
on ___. 

In the ED,  
Initial Vitals: 98.1 81 124/57 16 99% RA 

Exam: Melanotic stool in rectum, guaiac positive
Abdomen soft, non-tender, non-distended

Labs: Hgb 6.0, INR: 3.0, lactate 2.8

Imaging: None 

Consults: None 

Interventions: 1U pRBC 

On the floor, the patient reports feeling okay. 

He states that he was never told he had recurrent bleeding in 
his
stools and didn't notice any. He states that he had 1BM 
yesterday
and none the day prior. He had some mild nausea when he first
arrived on the flor that resolved spontaneously. 

He denies chest pain, shortness of breath, lightheadedness or
dizziness.

Patient states he has chronic left leg swelling. No orthopnea
(sleeps on 1 pillow).  No PND or known changes in weight. No URI
symptoms,
fever or chills.

Critical aortic stenosis s/p TAVR

CAD / ischemic cardiomyopathy (apical MI in ___ tx w/ CABG,

MICRO
=======
N/A

IMAGING/STUDIES
=================
CT Chest
Moderate bilateral pleural effusions right greater than left 
with bibasilar 
atelectasis.  Mild interstitial edema. 
  
Evidence of prior cardiac surgery.  Prosthetic aortic valve in 
place. 
  
Anasarca. 
  
Right-sided pacemaker. 

CT A/P
  
1. No acute intra-abdominal or intrapelvic pathology. 
2. Cholelithiasis without acute cholecystitis. 
3. Re-demonstration of a mildly nodular liver suggestive of 
cardiac 
hepatopathy or cardiac cirrhosis in the setting of fluid 
overload. 
4. Small volume ascites. 
5. Diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis. 
6. Please refer to dedicated CT chest performed on same day for 
description of 
intrathoracic findings. 

TTE
The left atrial volume index is SEVERELY increased. No 
thrombus/mass is seen in the body of the left atrium
(best excluded by TEE). The right atrium is mildly enlarged. 
There is a possible atrial septal defect. There is
mild symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy with a borderline 
increased/dilated cavity. There is suboptimal
image quality to assess regional left ventricular function. 
Overall left ventricular systolic function is severely
depressed. The visually estimated left ventricular ejection 
fraction is ___. Left ventricular cardiac
index is low normal (2.0-2.5 L/min/m2). There is no resting left 
ventricular outflow tract gradient. Diastolic
function could not be assessed. Normal right ventricular cavity 
size with depressed free wall motion. Intrinsic
right ventricular systolic function is likely lower due to the 
severity of tricuspid regurgitation. There is
abnormal interventricular septal motion c/w right ventricular 
pressure and volume overload. The aortic sinus
diameter is normal for gender with mildly dilated ascending 
aorta. A ___ aortic valve bioprosthesis is
present. The prosthesis is well seated with leaflets not well 
seen but normal gradient. No mass/vegetation
seen, but cannot fully exclude due to suboptimal image quality. 
There is a paravalvular jet of mild [1+] aortic
regurgitation. The mitral valve leaflets are mildly thickened 
with no mitral valve prolapse. No masses or
vegetations are seen on the mitral valve. There is moderate [2+] 
mitral regurgitation. The pulmonic valve
leaflets are normal. The tricuspid valve leaflets appear 
structurally normal. No mass/vegetation seen, but
cannot exclude due to suboptimal image quality. There is SEVERE 
[4+] tricuspid regurgitation. Due to acoustic
shadowing, the severity of tricuspid regurgitation may be 
UNDERestimated. There is SEVERE pulmonary artery
systolic hypertension. In the setting of at least moderate to 
severe tricuspid regurgitation, the pulmonary
artery systolic pressure may be UNDERestimated. There is no 
pericardial effusion. A left pleural effusion is
present.
Compared with the prior TTE (images not available for review) of 
___ , the estimated pulmonary
artery systolic pressure is now increased. There is evidence of 
RV pressure/volume overload. Regional function
cannot be fully assessed due to suboptimal image quality.

NCHCT
1. New small late acute/subacute right frontal lobe infarct. 
2. No midline shift or intracranial hemorrhage. 
3. Probably chronic right temporal lobe subcortical white matter 
infarct. 

MRI BRAIN ___
 No evidence of acute infarction, hemorrhage or intracranial 
mass.
2. Minimal white matter changes in the cerebral hemispheres 
bilaterally,
nonspecific but suggestive of chronic microangiopathy.  Probable 
small old
infarct in the right anterior frontal lobe.
3. Intermittent visualization of the distal cervical left 
vertebral artery and
its proximal intradural portion, possibly artifactual due to 
slow flow. 
Unremarkable remainder of the intradural left V4 segment.
4. Otherwise patent intracranial vasculature without evidence of 
high-grade
stenosis, vessel occlusion or aneurysm formation.
 
 
Brief Hospital Course:
HOSPITAL COURSE
==================

Mr. ___ is a ___ y/o male with a history of HFrEF (EF 25% 
___, afib on apixaban, severe AS s/p TAVR, complete heart 
block s/p dual lead AICD, CKD, DM, and PVD s/p left SFA to DP 
bypass graft who presented with rectal bleeding secondary to a 
Dieulafoy lesion that resolved with clip. Patient had a 
prolonged complex hospital course notable for bleeding from his 
DP bypass site on ___ requiring transfer to vascular surgery 
and Ligation of L SFA-DP bypass on ___ and eventual BKA on 
___. Patient subsequently developed hypervolemia secondary to 
decompensated HFrEF, for which he received aggressive diuresis 
on the medicine service complicated by ___ secondary to ATN 
exacerbated by CIN. Unfortunately, patient renal function 
continued to worsen over the course of the final week of his 
hospitalization and his hypervolemia was refractory to maximal 
medical diuretic therapy and he developed worsening uremia and 
initial signs of electrolyte derangements. Of note, patient was 
also noted to have coagulopathy as well as thrombocytopenia on 
laboratory studies with nodular fibrotic liver on imaging all 
consistent with likely cardiogenic cirrhosis.

In the setting of these multiple medical issues, patient mental 
status declined sharply even requiring MICU transfer on ___ for 
severe encephalopathy and concern for respiratory status. This 
encephalopathy was likely multifactorial in the setting of 
rising uremia, nutritional deficiency from prolonged hospital 
course, hepatic encephalopathy, and hospital acquired delirium. 
In spite of maximal medical therapy with vitamin repletion, 
lactulose, and delirium precautions, patient mental status 
continued to deteriorate until he was entirely unable to engage 
with his surroundings. 

A family meeting was held on ___ with patient's adult children 
including his healthcare proxy and son, ___. During this 
meeting it was explained that the patient was highly unlikely to 
experience meaningful recovery in either mental status or renal 
function and his overall prognosis in the setting of multiorgan 
failure (cardiac, renal, hepatic) was poor. The patient had a 
clear expressed wish to move forward with renal replacement 
therapy as well as to limit medical interventions that would not 
restore his independent quality of life and, therefore it was 
decided to transition patient to CMO on ___. Patient expired on 
___ in no apparent distress.

Insulin SC Sliding Scale using HUM Insulin
18. TraZODone 25 mg PO QHS:PRN insomnia  
19. FoLIC Acid 1 mg PO DAILY 
20. Polyethylene Glycol 17 g PO DAILY

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
